The Licchavi said:
'If you do not accept precious things, may the World-Honored One accept the sandalwood incense.'
The Buddha then accepted it.
A monk used coarse beans to wash his bowl, which damaged the color of the bowl.
The Buddha said:
'You should grind them well and sift the fine particles before using them.'
There was a woman whose husband had passed away. Her sexual desires were rampant, and she had an affair with an outsider, which resulted in pregnancy.
Fearing that the affair would be exposed, she told her lover to get medicine to abort the fetus.
This person obtained the medicine from monks and nuns, and then aborted the fetus.
Hearing this, the Buddha established a precept, saying:
'It is not allowed for those who have left the household life to give people medicine to abort fetuses.
